IRS990.Description: Educational Programs, General/Other: The school provides a private nonsectarian school of instruction for approximately 1,097 children in preschool, kindergarten, grade school and high school.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The primary use of the funds is to provide income for the Organization. Within these funds the donors have specified uses for scholarships, technology, and learning center.
Parent Association expenses (263,099) and Cost of goods sold (53,082).
Cost of goods sold (53,082), Unrealized swap loss (726,729), Special event expenses (263,099)

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The School annually publicizes in the Washington Post their nondiscriminatory policy through the Virginia Association of independent schools.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Our financial Aid awards are based upon need and not merit. We use SSS a service provided by the National Association of Independent Schools to help us determine the award. Families complete a lengthly application and then send it to SSS. We receive back what SSS thinks the family can contribute to tuition as a guide in awarding a grant. We also take into account cost of living and other conditions. All applications are reviewed by The Financial Aid Committee. In addition we gather tax information from families as a way to confirm information.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The Headmaster and some Key Employees are provided houses by Flint Hill School. The Headmaster and Key Employees need to be avaliable 24 hours a day for any emergency or other issue that would require their attention.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The bylaw changes have already been submitted.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The School has an audit committee that reviews the tax return before it is filed.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Trustees has a written Conflict of Interest policy and a copy is given to each Trustee once a year to be read, signed and collected by the Board Secretary and filed for record.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The national, state and regional independent school organizations, to which this school is a member, collect statistical data every year including salary and benefit information of key employees. The results are used as comparability data in determining fair salaries. The headmaster's salary and expense account are determined by the Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees, with discussion to come to a decision. All other benefits are the same as all other employees of the school. The salary for the Business Manager and other key employees is determined using the same comparability data, with annual increases determined as a percentage by the full Board of Trustees.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The School makes these documents avaliable to the public upon request.
